news_header: Tax rates in Finland vary by municipality, with Helsinki having the lowest taxes for middle-income earners this year. The Central Confederation of Taxpayers compared municipal taxes, highlighting that Southern Savo Mikkeli has the highest tax burden.
news_original_title: Maakuntakeskuksista Helsinki verottaa keskituloisia kaikkein kevyimmin
news_text: The difference between Helsinki and Mikkeli is nearly EUR 3,700. Other high-tax municipalities include Kokkola and Kouvola, while Turku and Tampere have lower rates. Halsua has the highest overall taxation rate, while Kauniainen has the lowest. A total of 68 municipalities raised their tax rates this year, with an average municipal tax rate of 7.54%.
